00022 // A magic number that indicates an image either has no exif tag, or
00023 // the exif tag does not have a focal length
00024 const int BUNDLER_NO_FOCAL_LEN = -1;

00033 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00034 // A single feature. Contains a (row, col), which is the location in the
00035 // image of the feature, and a vector of doubles, the feature descriptor.
00036 struct bundler_inters_feature : public vbl_ref_count
00037 {
00038     vgl_point_2d<double> point;
00039     vnl_vector<double> descriptor;
00040 
00041     // Pointers to other classes that hold this feature.
00042 
00043     // Not all features are in tracks (for example, if 3D point
00044     // is only visible in one image, or there is a unmatched feature).
00045     // Be sure to check if track is valid.
00046     bundler_inters_track_sptr track; // Other views of same 3D pt
00047     int index_in_track;
00048 
00049     bundler_inters_image_sptr image; // Others features from same image
00050     int index_in_image;
00051 
00052     // General purpose boolean marking this feature as seen.
00053     // Useful in a variety of situations, such as depth-first search.
00054     bool visited;
00055 
00056 
00057     // Constructors
00058     bundler_inters_feature();
00059     bundler_inters_feature(
00060         double row,
00061         double col,
00062         const vnl_vector<double> &d,
00063         const bundler_inters_image_sptr &img,
00064         int index_in_image);
00065 
00066     void mark_as_contributing();
00067     bool is_contributing() const;
00068 };
00069 
00070 
00071 // A smart pointer typedef, to ease up on memory management.
00072 typedef vbl_smart_ptr<bundler_inters_feature>
00073     bundler_inters_feature_sptr;
00074 
00075 
00076 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00077 // A set of features that all come from the same image
00078 struct bundler_inters_image : public vbl_ref_count
00079 {
00080     // Information about the actual image.
00081     vil_image_resource_sptr source;
00082     double focal_length;
00083 
00084     // All the features in this image. They will be in different tracks.
00085     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr> features;
00086 
00087     // True if at least one feature in the set is
00088     // been used to triangulate a track.
00089     bool in_recon;
00090 
00091     // The camera that was used to take this image.
00092     vpgl_perspective_camera<double> camera;
00093 
00094     bundler_inters_image() :
00095         in_recon(false) { }
00096 
00097     void remove_if_present(bundler_inters_feature_sptr const& f);
00098 };
00099 
00100 
00101 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00102 // A pair of images, and the features for
00103 // those images. An instance of this type represents a container that
00104 // holds two images whose features should be matched.
00105 struct bundler_inters_image_pair
00106 {
00107     bundler_inters_image_sptr f1;
00108     bundler_inters_image_sptr f2;
00109 };
00110 
00111 
00112 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00113 typedef
00114     vcl_pair<bundler_inters_feature_sptr, bundler_inters_feature_sptr>
00115     bundler_inters_feature_pair;
00116 
00117 // A set of matched features between two images.
00118 struct bundler_inters_match_set
00119 {
00120     //--------------Public Fields
00121     bundler_inters_image_sptr image1, image2;
00122     vcl_vector< bundler_inters_feature_pair > matches;
00123 
00124 
00125     //--------------Public Functions
00126     bundler_inters_match_set();
00127 
00128 
00129     // Returns the number of features in the match.
00130     int num_features() const;
00131 
00132 
00133     // Adds a new match to the list
00134     void add_match(bundler_inters_feature_sptr f1,
00135                    bundler_inters_feature_sptr f2);
00136 
00137     // Deletes a match from the list
00138     void remove_feature(int index);
00139     void remove_if_present(bundler_inters_feature_sptr const& f);
00140 
00141     // Removes all matches from the list
00142     void clear();
00143 
00144 
00145     // Estimates a homography, and returns the percentage of inliers
00146     // for the estimated homography. This is cached until the match set
00147     // is changed by adding or removing a match.
00148     double get_homography_inlier_percentage(
00149         int num_ransac_rounds, double thresh_sq) const;
00150 
00151 
00152   private:
00153     void reset_inlier_percentage();
00154     mutable double inlier_percentage;
00155 };

00158 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00159 // This represents a 3-d point. It holds the features that view it,
00160 // the location of the 3-d point, and which features have been incorporated
00161 // into the location.
00162 struct bundler_inters_track : public vbl_ref_count
00163 {
00164     // All these points will be from different images.
00165     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr> points;
00166     vcl_vector<bool> contributing_points;
00167 
00168     vgl_point_3d<double> world_point;
00169 
00170     bool observed;
00171 
00172     bundler_inters_track() :
00173         observed(false) { }
00174 
00175     // Returns the place the feature was added.
00176     int add_feature(bundler_inters_feature_sptr const& f){
00177         points.push_back(f);
00178         contributing_points.push_back(false);
00179 
00180         return points.size() - 1;
00181     }
00182 
00183     void remove_if_present(bundler_inters_feature_sptr const& f);
00184 };
00185

00187 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00188 // A list of feature sets, match sets, and tracks
00189 struct bundler_inters_reconstruction
00190 {
00191     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> feature_sets;
00192     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_track_sptr> tracks;
00193 
00194     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_match_set> match_sets;
00195 
00196     vnl_sparse_matrix<bool> visibility_matrix;
00197 };
